xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: A module for XML validation and grammars functions.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:integer : the number of deleted grammars.
node() : an XML document containing details on all cached grammars.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Pre parse grammars and add to grammar cache. Only XML schemas (.xsd) are supported.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $grammar* Reference to grammar.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:string* : sequence of namespaces of preparsed grammars.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: validation:jaxv
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: validation:jaxv($instance as item(), $grammars as item()+) as xs:boolean

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Validate document specified by $instance using the schemas in $grammars. Based on functionality provided by 'javax.xml.validation.Validator'. Only '.xsd' grammars are supported.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $instance The document referenced as xs:anyURI, a node (element or returned by fn:doc()) or as a Java file object.

$grammars+ The namespace URI to designate a schema language. Depending on the jaxv.SchemaFactory implementation the following values are valid:(XSD 1.0) http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema http://www.w3.org/XML/XMLSchema/v1.0, (XSD 1.1) http://www.w3.org/XML/XMLSchema/v1.1, (RELAX NG 1.0) http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:boolean : true() if the document is valid and no single problem occured, false() for all other conditions. For detailed validation information use the corresponding -report() function.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: validation:jaxv

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Validate document specified by $instance using the schemas in $grammars. Based on functionality provided by 'javax.xml.validation.Validator'. Only '.xsd' grammars are supported.

$language The namespace URI to designate a schema language. Depending on the jaxv.SchemaFactory implementation the following values are valid:(XSD 1.0) http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema http://www.w3.org/XML/XMLSchema/v1.0, (XSD 1.1) http://www.w3.org/XML/XMLSchema/v1.1, (RELAX NG 1.0) http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:boolean : true() if the document is valid and no single problem occured, false() for all other conditions. For detailed validation information use the corresponding -report() function.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: validation:jing
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: validation:jing($instance as item(), $grammar as item()) as xs:boolean

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Validate document using 'Jing'. Supported grammar documents extensions are ".xsd" ".rng" ".rnc" ".sch" and ".nvdl". Based on functionality provided by 'com.thaiopensource.validate.ValidationDriver'.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $instance The document referenced as xs:anyURI, a node (element or returned by fn:doc()) or as a Java file object.
$grammar The grammar document as node (element of returned by fn:doc()), xs:anyURI, returned by util:binary-doc() or as a Java file object.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:boolean : true() if the document is valid and no single problem occured, false() for all other conditions. For detailed validation information use the corresponding -report() function.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: validation:jaxp
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: validation:jaxp($instance as item(), $cache-grammars as xs:boolean) as xs:boolean

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Validate document by parsing $instance. Optionally grammar caching can be enabled. Supported grammars types are '.xsd' and '.dtd'.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $instance The document referenced as xs:anyURI, a node (element or result of fn:doc()) or as a Java file object.
$cache-grammars Set the flag to true() to enable grammar caching.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:boolean : true() if the document is valid and no single problem occured, false() for all other conditions. For detailed validation information use the corresponding -report() function.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: xs:boolean : true() if the document is valid and no single problem occured, false() for all other conditions. For detailed validation information use the corresponding -report() function.
